entry.et: Middle English, from Old English seolc, sioluc, probably ultimately from Greek sērikos silken sericeous

def.dt: :a fine continuous protein fiber produced by various insect larvae usually for cocoons
:a lustrous tough elastic fiber produced by silkworms and used for textiles
:thread, yarn, or fabric made from silk filaments
:a garment of silk
:a distinctive silk gown worn by a King's or Queen's Counsel
:a King's or Queen's Counsel
:the colored cap and blouse of a jockey or harness horse driver made in the registered racing color of the employing stable
:a filament resembling silk
:one produced by a spider
:silky material milkweed silk
:the styles of an ear of Indian corn
:parachute
:to develop the silk
:the silky or cottony covering of seeds of various silk-cotton trees
:kapok
:any of various tropical trees (family Bombacaceae, the silk-cotton family) with palmate leaves and large fruits with the seeds enveloped by silk cotton
:ceiba 1
:a gland that produces a viscid fluid which is extruded in filaments and hardens into silk on exposure to air: as
:either of a pair of greatly enlarged and modified salivary glands of an insect larva that produce a compound filament from which a larval or pupal cover (as a cocoon) is spun
:any of two or more abdominal glands of a spider that open through spinnerets and produce a filament used chiefly in the spinning of webs
:a hat with a tall cylindrical crown and a silk-plush finish worn by men as a dress hat
:the common silkworm (Bombyx mori)
:saturniid
:one (as the cecropia moth) that produces a cocoon of silk
:any of various Australian timber trees (especially genus Grevillea) of the protea family that have mottled wood used in cabinetmaking and veneering called also silky oak

:a stencil process in which coloring matter is forced onto the material to be printed through the meshes of a silk or organdy screen so prepared as to have pervious printing areas and impervious nonprinting areas
:a print made by this process
:an aristocratic or wealthy person
:a fashionably dressed person
:federalist 2
